text: this video is sponsored by

is my latest scratch-build it's a
multi-purpose twin cargo plane designed
to lift heavy things the wingspan is 57
inches and the wing and fuselage are
made from 2-inch thick
pink insulation foam from Home Depot the
tail is made from six millimeter depron
and is held by a 25 millimeter carbon
boom it's powered by two 750 kV our CMC
multi rotor motors with 14-inch carbon
props these run off a 3000 milliamp hour
four cell lipo the receiver and other
electronics are cut into the fuselage it
has thick aluminum landing gear that
connect to a carbon fiber plate and a
fixed tail wheel in the back despite
this it's still fairly controllable on
the ground because of a differential
thrust setup this is where one motor
speeds up and the other slows down to
turn I cut the airfoil with my DIY hot
wire bow the total takeoff weight with
no cargo is three pounds and seven
ounces
it's very stable in the air and has a
ton of lift it flies pretty slowly and
glides especially because the huge-o
I was too close
there we go mistakes soon I'm gonna
downsize to 12 inch props because the 14
errs occasionally stall the motors at
full throttle these props are too big so
the motor stall
that's a short one
you
soon I'll be using this platform to lift
and drop various things and also put
